headline: Trump says ‘the American people deserve answers’ on the election
author: Timothy Frudd
sentences:
'”
The 45th president added, “Based on the already released information regarding the Rigged and Stolen 2020 Presidential Election, including mail-in ballots without signatures and forgeries, as well as the disgusting refusal to turn over documents, now is finally the time for the Arizona Attorney General to issue warrants and take his investigation to the next level.”
Trump’s comments come after Maricopa County has seemingly refused to comply with requests by Arizona’s Assistant Attorney General Jennifer Wright to present information about widespread fraud in the 2020 presidential election.

On Friday, the 45th president challenged Brnovich, “When is the Attorney General of Arizona going to rule on all of the Election Fraud and large-scale Election Irregularities that wait before him?”
In response to Maricopa County seemingly refusing to release information concerning voter fraud, Trump stated, “The supervisors just won’t release the information-it must really be bad!”
Trump concluded his statement, expressing the need for the various investigations into the 2020 election to proceed quickly, saying, “The American people deserve answers, and there is no time to waste!”

On Sunday, Arizona Senate President Karen Fann released images of the official request presented to Maricopa County, accompanied by a statement, saying, “Looks like Maricopa BOS doesn’t want to comply with AG’s request for documents.
Trump asserted, “Arizona Senate President Karen Fann is asking the exact right question about the corrupt Maricopa County Board of Supervisors, ‘What are they hiding now?

Photo credit: Alamy
President Donald Trump blasted the Maricopa County Board of Supervisors Monday for “hiding” information regarding the 2020 presidential election.
Wright submitted the request on March 9; however, the Maricopa County Board of Supervisors has been reluctant to deliver the requested records and materials.

What are they hiding now?”
Trump’s lengthy statements echo the words of Fann and demand a response from Arizona’s Attorney General Mark Brnovich.
